719046f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Broome Street
719046f-a.text:
Columbda Street, west side, south from and including Broome Street,
to and including Grand Street.
April 4, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719046f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

719043f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Broome Street
719043f-a.text:
22 to 4 (left to right) Columbia Street, east side, south from Broome
(left), to but not including Grand (right) Streets, showing construction
work in progress on the west side of the street (the former site of the
main plant of R. Hoe and Co., renowned printing press manufacturers) on
a new apartment house. lIncluded is a general view of the surrounding area,
with the Williamsburg Bridge in the background.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719043f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

719048f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Broome Street
719048f-a.text:
Columbia Street, east side, from and including Broome Street
to Williamsburg Bridge just south of Delancey Street.
October 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719048f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717839f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Columbia Street
717839f-a.text:
Broome Street, east from and including Columbia Street, to the East
River. In the background, appears faintly, the Brooklyn shore.
March 26, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717839f-a.folder: Broome Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

717840f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Columbia Street
717840f-a.text:
Broome Street (left), at the N.W. corner of Columbia (right) Street,
showing a Playground occupying the entire block from Columbia to Sheriff
Streets, and from Broome to Delancey Streets. Also shown (left) is the
5-story annex building of R. Hoe and Co., renowned printing press
Manufacturing firm, now occupied as a broom factory, and a portion of the
Williamsburg Bridge (on Delancey Street).
March 26, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717840f-a.folder: Broome Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

717841f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Columbia Street
717841f-a.text:
(1)
Broome Street, west from and including Columbia Street, showing the
printing press factory of R. Hoe and Company on both sides of the
street, between Columbia and Sheriff Streets. Both units were demolished,
the one on the left is the site of a model apartment, and the other a
playaround; today 1937.
April 4, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing construction work in progress
for the ''slum clearance'' project. Governor Herbert Lehman was an
active participant.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717841f-a.folder: Broome Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

717841f-b.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Columbia Street
717841f-b.text:
(1)
Broome Street, west from and including Columbia Street, showing the
printing press factory of R. Hoe and Company on both sides of the
street, between Columbia and Sheriff Streets. Both units were demolished,
the one on the left is the site of a model apartment, and the other a
playaround; today 1937.
April 4, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing construction work in progress
for the ''slum clearance'' project. Governor Herbert Lehman was an
active participant.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717841f-b.folder: Broome Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY
